episodeTitle: The Fateful Reunion! Bellamy the Hyena!
description: Luffy encounters an old adversary from Jaya as Bellamy enters the Corrida Colosseum tournament. Meanwhile, Zoro pursues a mysterious fairy who stole his sword, and strange noises emanate from within the Thousand Sunny.

events.title: CP0 Agents Debut in Dressrosa
events.description: CP0 agents including Guernika, Joseph, and Gismonda make their first appearance in the series. The mysterious elite intelligence operatives are shown observing events in Dressrosa, establishing their presence in the arc.
events.significance: First introduction of CP0, the world's strongest intelligence agency, setting up their role in future story developments. This marks an important expansion of the World Government's presence in the narrative.

events.title: Luffy Reunites with Bellamy
events.description: At the Corrida Colosseum, Luffy encounters Bellamy for the first time since their confrontation at Jaya. The reunion is tense but shows Bellamy's character development as he has gained respect for Luffy after learning Sky Island was real.
events.significance: Demonstrates Bellamy's character growth and transformation from a dream-mocking antagonist to someone who acknowledges Luffy's achievements. This reunion sets up their complex relationship throughout the Dressrosa arc.

quotes.text: It's been a while, Straw Hat.
quotes.speaker: Bellamy
quotes.context: Bellamy acknowledging Luffy at the Colosseum

events.title: Bartolomeo Enters Block B Arena
events.description: Bartolomeo makes his dramatic entrance into the Corrida Colosseum's Block B battle. The announcer reveals he has a bounty of 150,000,000 berries and is described as cruel and crazy, holding the number one spot for the person people most want to disappear.
events.significance: Introduces one of Luffy's most devoted fans and future ally as a mysterious and intimidating competitor. Bartolomeo's entrance builds anticipation for his abilities and role in the tournament.

quotes.text: With a bounty of 150 million berries, the man the crowd wants to disappear most... Bartolomeo the Cannibal!
quotes.speaker: Announcer

events.title: Bartolomeo Defeats Gambia
events.description: Bartolomeo's crew member Gambia is knocked down by Vice Admiral Maynard (in disguise). In retaliation, Bartolomeo violently defeats Maynard, demonstrating his care for his crew and his combat prowess.
events.significance: Shows Bartolomeo's loyalty to his crew and hints at his mysterious abilities through hand gestures. Establishes his strength by defeating a Vice Admiral.

events.title: Hint at Bartolomeo's Barrier Ability
events.description: The anime expands on Bartolomeo's interaction with the defeated Gambia, showing him crossing his fingers in specific gestures. This subtle hint foreshadows his Bari Bari no Mi (Barrier-Barrier Fruit) powers.
events.significance: First visual clue to Bartolomeo's Devil Fruit ability, which will be fully revealed in subsequent episodes. The hand gesture becomes his signature move for creating barriers.

events.title: Law's Team Learns About Green Bit
events.description: The Caesar handover team discusses Green Bit at a northeastern cafe. They are warned about dangerous fighting fish and learn that no one who has used the iron bridge to Green Bit has ever returned. Law refuses to change the drop-off location despite the warnings.
events.significance: Sets up the dangerous nature of Green Bit and builds tension for the upcoming Caesar handover. The warnings foreshadow the challenges the team will face.

quotes.text: No one who used the iron bridge to Green Bit has ever come back.
quotes.speaker: Cafe patron

events.title: Wicca Steals Zoro's Sword
events.description: Zoro chases after a mysterious 'fairy' who stole his sword Shusui. He catches up to the fairy on top of a building and retrieves his sword, but both fall from the roof. Zoro manages to catch the fairy, later revealed to be Wicca, a dwarf from the Tontatta Kingdom.
events.significance: Introduces the Tontatta dwarves (disguised as fairies) to the story. This encounter leads to Zoro and others learning about the dwarves' situation and the truth about Dressrosa.

quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro explaining why he's chasing someone

events.title: Kin'emon Surrounded by Enemies, Sanji Rescues Him
events.description: Kin'emon gets lost and is surrounded by Doflamingo's agents who threaten him about his captured comrade Kanjuro. Sanji arrives and defeats the sniper threatening them, rescuing Kin'emon. They learn Kanjuro is being held at a 'toy house.'
events.significance: Advances the subplot of rescuing Kanjuro and demonstrates Sanji's combat abilities and observation skills. Sets up the mystery of the toy house and Doflamingo's operations.

quotes.text: If you don't cooperate, we will kill you and your friend.
quotes.speaker: Doflamingo's agent

events.title: Mysterious Noises on the Thousand Sunny
events.description: The crew members guarding the Thousand Sunny (Nami, Chopper, Brook, and Momonosuke) hear strange noises coming from inside the ship while playing Shogun. The source of the noises remains mysterious.
events.significance: Creates suspense and foreshadows an upcoming threat or intruder on the ship. This mystery will be resolved in later episodes when the source is revealed.

quotes.text: Did you hear that? Something's moving inside the ship!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Hearing mysterious noises on the Sunny

quotes.text: It's been a while, Straw Hat.
quotes.speaker: Bellamy
quotes.context: Bellamy greeting Luffy at the Colosseum, showing his changed attitude

quotes.text: With a bounty of 150 million berries, the man the crowd wants to disappear most... Bartolomeo the Cannibal!
quotes.speaker: Announcer
quotes.context: Introducing Bartolomeo to the arena crowd

quotes.text: No one who used the iron bridge to Green Bit has ever come back.
quotes.speaker: Cafe patron
quotes.context: Warning Law's team about the dangers of Green Bit

themes.description: Bellamy's reunion with Luffy showcases his character development from a dream-mocking antagonist to someone who acknowledges his mistakes and respects Luffy's achievements.
themes.symbolism: The changed dynamic between Luffy and Bellamy represents how experiences can transform one's worldview and values.

themes.description: Multiple mysteries are introduced: CP0's presence, the noises on the Sunny, the identity of the 'fairies,' and the dangers of Green Bit.
themes.symbolism: The layered mysteries reflect Dressrosa's hidden secrets and the complex web of events unfolding on the island.

themes.description: Bartolomeo's fierce defense of Gambia and Sanji's rescue of Kin'emon demonstrate the importance of protecting one's comrades.
themes.symbolism: These acts of loyalty parallel the Straw Hats' core values and foreshadow alliances to come.

characterSpotlights.development: Bellamy shows significant character growth since Jaya, acknowledging Luffy's dreams and achievements. His presence at the Colosseum sets up his complex role in the Dressrosa arc.
keyActions: Encounters Luffy at the Corrida Colosseum
quotes: It's been a while, Straw Hat.

characterSpotlights.development: Introduced as a cruel and intimidating pirate with a massive bounty, but hints at his barrier abilities and fierce loyalty to his crew. His true nature as a Luffy fanboy remains hidden.
keyActions: Makes dramatic entrance in Block B
Shows hand gestures hinting at barrier ability

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro's pursuit of the sword thief leads to the discovery of the Tontatta dwarves, advancing the subplot about Dressrosa's secrets.
keyActions: Catches Wicca after falling from a building
Begins to uncover the truth about the dwarves

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Bartolomeo's interaction with the defeated Gambia, adding more detail to his hand gestures that hint at his barrier ability.
Additional scenes showing the crew on the Thousand Sunny hearing the mysterious noises were extended for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of CP0 in the anime, introducing the World Government's strongest intelligence agency.
Bellamy's bounty increased from 55 million berries to 195 million berries during the timeskip, showing his significant growth as a pirate.
Bartolomeo's bounty of 150 million berries makes him one of the Super Rookies, pirates who reached the Sabaody Archipelago with bounties over 100 million.
The episode adapts chapters 705-706 of the manga, maintaining relatively close pacing compared to later Dressrosa episodes.
Episode 635 had a TV rating of 7.4%, ranking 6th among anime broadcasts during its timeslot.
The Tontatta dwarves (like Wicca) are based on the fairy tale creatures of European folklore, but Oda gave them a unique One Piece twist by making them actual tiny people rather than magical beings.
